Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana

entry.title: New Time Units for Higher Productivity (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

entry.title: The Input Channel Audit (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

The Input Channel Audit

A quick How To guide for shaping your information diet

entry.title: Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

entry.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive – you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

entry.title: The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

entry.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

entry.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

entry.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

entry.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

entry.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them – and possibly what to do instead.

entry.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true – sometimes you need to context switch.

entry.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable – but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

entry.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

entry.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

entry.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

entry.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

entry.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

entry.title: The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the ∆ feature in Roam.

entry.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

entry.title: A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Spaced Repetition

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

How to use Roam Research's new Delta feature to do Spaced Repetition and never forget anything again.

entry.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

entry.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

entry.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

entry.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

entry.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

entry.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

entry.title: A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Roam Research

A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

entry.title: Pathogen spillover driven by rapid changes in bat ecology (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Pathogen spillover driven by rapid changes in bat ecology

  • Peggy Eby
  • Alison J. Peel
  • Raina K. Plowright
Article 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: T cells specific for α-myosin drive immunotherapy-related myocarditis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
T cells specific for α-myosin drive immunotherapy-related myocarditis

Cytotoxic CD8+ T cells specific for α-myosin are identified as pivotal players in myocarditis associated with immune checkpoint inhibitor anticancer therapies.

  • Margaret L. Axelrod
  • Wouter C. Meijers
  • Justin M. Balko
Article 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: Direct activation of a bacterial innate immune system by a viral capsid protein (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Direct activation of a bacterial innate immune system by a viral capsid protein

Genetic, biochemical and structural studies provide insights into the function of Escherichia coli CapRelSJ46 as a fused anti-phage toxin–antitoxin system that binds SECΦ27 Gp57 capsid protein.

  • Tong Zhang
  • Hedvig Tamman
  • Michael T. Laub
Article Open Access 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: Effect of the intratumoral microbiota on spatial and cellular heterogeneity in cancer (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Effect of the intratumoral microbiota on spatial and cellular heterogeneity in cancer

Spatial profiling and single-cell RNA sequencing are used to map the spatial distribution of the microbiota within human tumours, revealing how intratumoral microbial communities contribute to tumour heterogeneity and cancer progression.

  • Jorge Luis Galeano Niño
  • Hanrui Wu
  • Susan Bullman
Article Open Access 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: Colon tumour cell death causes mTOR dependence by paracrine P2X4 stimulation (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Colon tumour cell death causes mTOR dependence by paracrine P2X4 stimulation

Chemotherapy-induced death of colon cancer cells causes ATP release triggering P2X4 to mediate an mTOR-dependent pro-survival program in neighbouring cancer cells, which renders them sensitive to mTOR inhibition.

  • Mark Schmitt
  • Fatih Ceteci
  • Florian R. Greten
Article 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: A hybrid optical–wireless network for decimetre-level terrestrial positioning (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A hybrid optical–wireless network for decimetre-level terrestrial positioning

A terrestrial networked positioning system based on a hybrid optical–wireless telecommunication infrastructure and that is independent of global navigation satellite systems is demonstrated for urban environments with decimetre-level accuracy. 

  • Jeroen C. J. Koelemeij
  • Han Dun
  • Christian C. J. M. Tiberius
Article 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: Enterococci enhance Clostridioides difficile pathogenesis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Enterococci enhance Clostridioides difficile pathogenesis

Enterococci enhance the fitness and pathogenesis of Clostridioides difficile in the gut by altering the amino acid composition and providing signals that increase its virulence towards the host.

  • Alexander B. Smith
  • Matthew L. Jenior
  • Joseph P. Zackular
Article 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: Spin–orbit microlaser emitting in a four-dimensional Hilbert space (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Spin–orbit microlaser emitting in a four-dimensional Hilbert space

A fully integrated semiconductor microlaser that exploits spin–orbit coupling of light emits in a four-dimensional Hilbert space, with flexible control of up to six degrees of freedom.

  • Zhifeng Zhang
  • Haoqi Zhao
  • Liang Feng
Article 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: Using machine learning to assess the livelihood impact of electricity access (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Using machine learning to assess the livelihood impact of electricity access

Advancements in satellite imagery and machine learning can be used to infer the causal impact of electricity access on livelihoods, providing a low-cost, generalizable approach to evaluating public policy in data-spare environments.

  • Nathan Ratledge
  • Gabe Cadamuro
  • Marshall Burke
Article 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: Medin co-aggregates with vascular amyloid-β in Alzheimer’s disease (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Medin co-aggregates with vascular amyloid-β in Alzheimer’s disease

Medin promotes the formation of vascular aggregates with amyloid-β in mouse models and in human patients with Alzheimer’s disease, and is associated with vascular defects and cognitive decline.

  • Jessica Wagner
  • Karoline Degenhardt
  • Jonas J. Neher
Article Open Access 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: Ferroptosis of tumour neutrophils causes immune suppression in cancer (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Ferroptosis of tumour neutrophils causes immune suppression in cancer

Pathologically activated neutrophils, termed myeloid-derived suppressor cells, in the tumour microenvironment spontaneously undergo ferroptosis, which negatively regulates anti-tumour immunity through the release of oxygenated lipids, therefore limiting the activity of human and mouse T cells.

  • Rina Kim
  • Ayumi Hashimoto
  • Dmitry I. Gabrilovich
Article 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: APOE4 impairs myelination via cholesterol dysregulation in oligodendrocytes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
APOE4 impairs myelination via cholesterol dysregulation in oligodendrocytes

APOE4 is associated with widespread gene expression changes across all cell types of the human brain, altered cholesterol homeostasis and transport signalling pathways, and decreased myelination in the brain.

  • Joel W. Blanchard
  • Leyla Anne Akay
  • Li-Huei Tsai
Article 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: THP9 enhances seed protein content and nitrogen-use efficiency in maize (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
THP9 enhances seed protein content and nitrogen-use efficiency in maize

Genetic analyses of teosinte, the wild ancestor of maize, identify a locus (THP9) that is associated with high seed protein content and increased nitrogen-use efficiency, suggesting that THP9 could have applications in crop breeding.

  • Yongcai Huang
  • Haihai Wang
  • Yongrui Wu
Article 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: Ocean currents show global intensification of weak tropical cyclones (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Ocean currents show global intensification of weak tropical cyclones

Both drifter current observations and satellite-based tropical cyclone (TC)-induced sea surface cooling demonstrate that weak TCs have intensified in recent decades.

  • Guihua Wang
  • Lingwei Wu
  • Shang-Ping Xie
Article 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: Integrated femtosecond pulse generator on thin-film lithium niobate (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Integrated femtosecond pulse generator on thin-film lithium niobate

A femtosecond pulse generator is realized using an electro-optic time-lens system integrated on a lithium niobate photonic chip, capable of tunable repetition rates and wavelengths.

  • Mengjie Yu
  • David Barton III
  • Marko Lončar
Article 16 Nov 2022

entry.title: Regulating surface potential maximizes voltage in all-perovskite tandems (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Regulating surface potential maximizes voltage in all-perovskite tandems

  • Hao Chen
  • Aidan Maxwell
  • Edward H. Sargent

entry.content:
Non-viral precision T cell receptor replacement for personalized cell therapy

  • Kyle Jacoby
  • Stefanie J. Mandl

entry.title: Multiple pathways for SARS-CoV-2 resistance to nirmatrelvir (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Multiple pathways for SARS-CoV-2 resistance to nirmatrelvir

  • Sho Iketani
  • Hiroshi Mohri
  • David D. Ho
Article 09 Nov 2022

entry.title: Parenchymal border macrophages regulate the flow dynamics of the cerebrospinal fluid (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Parenchymal border macrophages regulate the flow dynamics of the cerebrospinal fluid

Perivascular and leptomeningeal macrophages, collectively termed here parenchymal border macrophages, are shown to regulate flow dynamics of cerebrospinal fluid, implicating this cell population as new therapeutic targets in neurological diseases such as Alzheimer’s.

  • Antoine Drieu
  • Siling Du
  • Jonathan Kipnis
Article 09 Nov 2022
